Nohinek said he met with the family Tuesday morning and said they found out less than 24 hours ago about the four family members killed and an adult granddaughter who remains in the hospital. Nohinek said the family was coming back from a trip to East Texas.
“Our focus as attorneys turns toward trying to locate the source, from a legal standpoint, of the wreck,” said Nohinek.

He said every tractor-trailer has a “black box” like an airplane. He said the electronic control modules and other devices can show the truck’s speed at the time of the crash, if it was in cruise control, how long the truck was on the road, maintenance history, and many other details.

“While the family grieves, we work to make sure that we get this information as soon as possible. It’s very important information to get an idea of what was happening inside that vehicle at the time,” explained Nohinek.

On Monday, DPS named Hope Trans LLC as the company operating the big rig. U.S. Department of Transportation data shows the company’s trucks have a significantly higher out-of-service violation percentage than the national average for trucking companies.

“In 2024, this carrier had 146 inspections on the side of the road, and they had 159 violations. Their trucks were deemed out of service at a 33.8 percent rate, which is over 10 percent higher than the national average. So that kind of shows what kind of company we’re dealing with,” said Nohinek.
NBC 5 tried to reach out to the company on Monday and left a message.
Nohinek said their law firm is in the process of requesting access to the “black box,” but said it may take longer to see the data because of the investigation.
“They need to get all the information necessary before they let in civilians, attorneys,” he explained.
NBC 5 spoke with several family members and loved ones who said right now they’re not ready to talk.
“Clearly, the family is distraught,” said Nohinek. “In talking with them earlier today at their house, they’re struggling with this.”
A GoFundMe account for the family was set up to help the North Texas family.
The loss was felt keenly by the Hallmark Eagles youth sports program in Fort Worth, where the McKellar family had been involved for years and Kason started playing football at age 11.
“Whenever something like that happens, it’s bad enough if it’s one person,” said Newton Braziel with Hallmark Eagles. “But when it’s a family, man, your heart just can’t help but go out.”
The program tells NBC 5 it’s working to put together a way for its community to support the McKellar family in the wake of the tragedy.
“His loss touched a lot of families, a lot of friends,” coach Anthony Bartee said of Kason. “When my son told me about it last night, it really broke my spirits.”
On Monday, DPS said a sixth person died and that all five people in the mangled Ford F-150 died, but on Tuesday, authorities clarified that only five victims had died in the crash.

title: Mariska Hargitay Receives the Ultimate Surprise Gift in ‘My Mom Jayne’ Deleted Scene: ‘I Don’t Have Words’
summary: Mariska Hargitay's older brother Zoltan surprised her in a deleted scene from the "My Mom Jayne" documentary with sinks from Jayne Mansfield's Pink Palace home.
story: A one-of-a-kind gift once owned by her late mother left Mariska Hargitay speechless and emotional after it was presented to the television star by her older brother.
The touching moment was captured on video in a scene that was not included in Hargitay's HBO documentary about Jayne Mansfield,  “My Mom Jayne,” but was released on Instagram by HBO on July 1.
Hargitay's brother Zoltan Hargitay presented his sister with a pair of porcelain sinks, one with an original angel design in the basin and another with six hearts on it.

He told her the sinks belonged to Mansfield, who died at 34 in a car accident in 1967. Mariska Hargitay, who was just 3 years old at the time, was in the back seat with Zoltan Hargitay and their brother, Mickey Hargitay Jr., when it happened.
"These were Mom's sinks in her bathroom," Zoltan Hargitay says. "And I want you to have them. I get teary-eyed seeing like this, but these were her sinks."
Mariska Hargitay's jaw drops at seeing the gift.
"I can't believe you have this," she says.
The sinks appear to be ones that were once in Mansfield’s home on Sunset Boulevard in Los Angeles during her fame in the 1950s and early 1960s.
"When I saw these, I snatched them up really quick," Zoltan Hargitay says. "It was amazing."
Mariska Hargitay admires the angels in one of the sinks.
"And see how this is all original," Zoltan Hargitay says. "So there's only two sinks in the world. And one of them is bigger than the other one, so I'm thinking the bigger one was on the right."
"Maybe it was Dad's?" Mariska Hargitay says in reference to Mickey Hargitay.
The "Law & Order: SVU" star then appreciates the sink with hearts in the basin.
"Oh, my God, look at this," she says. "I don't even know what to say. Thank you."
"This belongs to you ... because she used this, and then you can have this and do the same," Zoltan Hargitay tells her. "Isn't that cool?"
"I don't have words for that," Mariska Hargitay replies. "I love this so much, Zolie."
The two then share a high-five.
"Two hands on the sinks!" Mariska Hargitay jokes.

The sinks add to the list of heartwarming keepsakes from her mom that Mariska Hargitay now has in her possession. For her 60th birthday, she received Mansfield's treasured grand piano in a scene at the end of "My Mom Jayne."
Zoltan Hargitay had been pondering what to do with the sinks before deciding his sister should have them.
"I initially wanted to incorporate it, but mother, daughter, and everything that you've done here for us," he says.
"So sweet," she replies.
Mariska Hargitay now has the sinks in her home.

“I just redid this bathroom because my brother, when they were tearing down the pink house, he got the sinks,” she told the Los Angeles Times in an interview about the film. “He gave them to me. I just ripped out our whole bathroom and had them put in with that pink marble. I’m living with her now, with pink roses and her sinks and my pink quartz hearts. She’s with me now.”

The documentary details Mariska Hargitay's journey toward learning more about her mother, examining her feelings about her mother's fame and discovering that Mickey Hargitay was not her biological father. The film reveals that Italian singer Nelson Sardelli is her biological father, which she did not learn until she was 25 years old.
"You kind of made everything full circle," Zoltan tells her. "Thank you so much."

title: Chuck E. Cheese Has Launched an Arcade for Adults. What It Includes
summary: Chuck E. Cheese has announced the launch of Chuck's Arcade locations for adults in eight states.
story: Chuck E. Cheese wants to make sure the grown-ups have fun, too.
The iconic kids arcade chain announced it's looking to cater to teens and adults by opening Chuck's Arcade locations across eight states, according to a news release.
Chuck's Arcade will feature retro favorites like Ms. Pac-Man, Mortal Kombat and Centipede alongside newer games like Jurassic Park and Halo, the company said.

There are already Chuck's Arcade locations in malls around the country, including in St. Petersburg, Florida; Trumbull, Connecticut; Oklahoma City and Tulsa, Oklahoma; Victor, New York; Buford, Georgia; El Paso, Texas; Nashua and Salem, New Hampshire; and St. Louis.
The location in Kansas City, Missouri, features a full menu and original artwork on the walls. The company said "no two locations are exactly alike."

"Chuck’s Arcade is a natural evolution — an opportunity to extend our arcade legacy into new formats that engage both lifelong fans and a new generation through a curated mix of retro classics and cutting-edge experiences," Chuck E. Cheese CEO David McKillips said in the news release.

Each venue will be "overseen" by one of the company's classic animatronic characters, from Chuck E. Cheese to other ones from Munch’s Make Believe Band. A video on the company's website shows a statue of a character encased in glass in the middle of the arcade.
Some locations will also sell clothing, toys and novelty candy, according to the company.

The new locations come amid an ongoing rebrand for the company, which declared bankruptcy in 2020. A corporate restructuring and a $350 million investment then led to electronic ticketing, more adult menu items and new play areas at its hundreds of locations.
In March, it announced it was removing the iconic animatronic band from its locations.

“Of course, if you think about entertainment 47 years ago, it was incredible to have the animatronic band and new music,” McKillips told NBC News at the time. “But in reality, the animatronics were getting tired.”
“Kids are consuming entertainment on a digital platform,” he added.
The launch of Chuck's Arcade is also a clear push to attract the same adult audience as rival Dave & Buster's, which began allowing customers 18 and older to bet on arcade games last year.

title: Rob McElhenney Defends Name Change in Cheeky Video: 'Times Have Changed'
summary: “It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia” star Rob McElhenney opened up about why he wants to change his name to Rob Mac.
story: Rob McElhenney isn’t making any apologies over his decision to change his name, but he is making a few jokes about it.
The “It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia” star addressed the move amid reports he has filed paperwork to change his name.
“Yes, I’m shortening my name to Rob Mac,” he said in the July 1 clip he posted on X, confirming the news himself. “Mostly a stage name, but I digress.”
He then used his trademark humor to explain just what has gone into his decision.

“The amount of time that I have wasted trying to get people to either say or spell my name correctly is literally days of my life,” he said, as quick clips of others saying his name wrong played in the middle of him speaking, “Trust me, I added it up.
“More importantly, it means thousands of you have had minutes of your life stolen by me because of my last name.”
McElhenney playfully pointed out the false connection the family has to the moniker.

“Still, it’s a family name,” he said. “My grandparents, parents, siblings, aunts, uncles, cousins and I all share it, and I love them and I want to stay connected. There’s heritage. Except, it’s not even really our f------ name.
He then explained how different generations have changed the spelling of it.

“The current one was just given to my ancestor by a government official who decided that this was now the spelling,” he said, while also revealing his great-great-grandmother went by Bridget McIllhenny.
McElhenney then dove into how ridiculous the whole matter is.

“Times have changed and most people already call me Rob Mac anyway,” he said. “My family knows me and loves me regardless of how many syllables I have, and that’s the only thing that I really care about. There are so many things going on in the world, and this is a silly one to continue to waste your time with."
McElhenney also said he’s OK with whatever name people want to give him, using the actual first names of celebrities as their pictures appeared on the screen.

“Honestly, call me whatever you want: Marion, Jerome, Archibald, Eric, Maurice, Stephanie, Frances, Marvin, Gordon or Sam. But maybe we just keep it simple and try Rob Mac. Let’s see how it goes,” he said.
In May, McElhenney opened up about how he was mulling over a name change in the wake of his multimedia company, More Better Industries, adding to its global portfolio.
“As our business and our storytelling is expanding into other regions of the world and other languages in which my name is even harder to pronounce, I’m just going by Rob Mac,” he told Variety.
The level of difficulty in pronouncing “McElhenney” is old hat. In 2023, his friend and fellow co-owner of Wrexham A.F.C. soccer club, Ryan Reynolds, released a humorous video about how to say it.
“It’s Mackle-Henney, it’s Mackle-Henney,” Reynolds sang with a roster of guest stars, including McElhenney's wife, Kaitlin Olson, and Philadelphia Eagles legend Jason Kelce.

title: 'The Bear' Season 4 Ending: Is Carmy Really Leaving the Restaurant?
summary: ‘The Bear’ Season 4 ending explained. Is Carmy leaving the restaurant? What is coming up in Season 5?
story: Spoilers ahead for “The Bear” Season 4.

So, did Carmy (Jeremy Allen White) and the rest of the crew get that Michelin star, or what? Well, the answer, like all things “The Bear,” is equal parts heartwarming, soul-stirring and frustratingly chaotic.

Before Season 4 dropped, Tina (Lisa Colón-Zayas) visited TODAY with Jenna and Friends and said that the season goes “much deeper” with the themes of “personal responsibility and reckoning,” guaranteeing more of the show’s heightened restaurant-kitchen anxiety that is now a trademark of the show.
“Doomsday could be coming,” she said in a spoiler-free preview, before adding, “I’m not saying it is, because I’m not saying that.”

On June 25, all 10 episodes of Season 4 dropped on Hulu/FX, and if you’re like me, you’ve binged every moment in rapid succession, much like sandwich orders coming through the gang’s long-abandoned ticket machine.
Now we know what Colón-Zayas meant: the future could be doomsday, or it could be exactly what all of our characters — especially Carmine “Carmy” Berzatto —  need to survive and finally thrive.
We’ve reached the end of another season full of marinara and mayhem, and here’s where our main players stand after Episode 10, “Goodbye.”
Sydney now knows Carmy’s plans

The episode opens on Sydney (Ayo Edebiri) resting her head against a fence in obvious frustration behind the restaurant. The following half hour and change is what is called a bottle episode, in that it unfolds on one set. Just like the tension that follows, the entire episode stews in this alleyway amongst the dumpsters.
Carmy enters and notes that Syd has pretty much ignored him all night.
“You good?” Carmy asks. (No, she is not good.)

At the end of Episode 9, after we find out Marcus has won Best New Chef from Food and Wine, Sydney finally found out from Pete (Chris Witaske) the exact terms of the updated partnership agreement she has avoided signing this season. Carmy wants to sign away his ownership of the restaurant, turning over The Bear to Uncle Jimmy (Oliver Platt), Natalie “Sugar” (Abby Elliott) and Syd.
As one would expect, Syd feels blind-sided, particularly after choosing her love for The Bear over her partnership with Adam Shapiro in Episode 8. Now, she’s ready to hash things out with Carmy.
Yes, Carmy does actually want to leave The Bear

It seems almost unbelievable that, after all this effort and at such a crucial time for the health of this very family-oriented business, that the restaurant's main driving Berzatto would want to leave, but there have been clues into Carmy's intentions all season.

First is Carmy’s actual efforts to heal some wounds, especially with Claire (Molly Gordon), his on-and-off (and maybe on again) girlfriend he fell out with thanks to a locked walk-in — and truly cruel admission — at the end of Season 2. He’s also timidly starting talking to his mother Donna (Jamie Lee Curtis) again.
Also, he’s seemed distant all season long; changes to the menu that would normally set this character on a roller coaster of screams and epithets were met with an eerie calm.
When he had no notes for Syd’s scallop dish, it felt like his work mentoring her was done — but neither her nor the audience picked up on it until now.
Sydney and Carmy fight over The Bear's future

“Can I actually just not hear you talk for one f---ing second?” Syd says as she attempts to smoke a cigarette, something our white t-shirted hero points out she does not usually do. She takes a trembling drag anyway.
Carmy tries to explain his thinking behind leaving the restaurant. First, he plans on staying on until the restaurant is financially viable, something it is very much isn’t at this juncture.

Nearly 1,440 hours — or two months — have passed on the clock Uncle Jimmy set up to show when he would stop funneling money into the restaurant, leading its employees to subsist solely on profit, which we’ve repeatedly been shown does not exist.
The chaos — both in action and the recently-shelved chaos menu of old — has led to the debt, in Carmy’s opinion.
“I don’t have anything to draw on, I don’t have anything to pull from,” Carmy says. “I was trying to put hurdles in the way.”

Syd lists many of the issues Carmy has: tensions with family, shaky mental health, non-existent stress management, anger issues and more, and he fully agrees with her. Carmy also reveals that he knew Syd was considering leaving for Shapiro’s new venture, but says he understands that, too, because of all of his issues.
Carmy thinks Syd, with her natural leadership, love of cuisine and her empathy, is the true future of the restaurant and she finally begins to see where he’s coming from, at least a little bit.
“I believe in you more than I’ve ever believed in myself,” he says, and she asks why. “Because you’re The Bear.”
The conversation devolves into screaming once again when Carmy says that Syd doesn’t need him.
“I know I don’t need you but that’s not the point,” Syd says through tears at someone she considers her partner. “You’re supposed to be here.”
Richie joins the argument and gets a promotion
Richie (Ebon Moss-Bachrach) hears all the shouting outside and enters the scene. He misunderstands when Syd says Carmy is leaving at first, just thinking he’s leaving early after closing.
“He’s leaving the f---ing restaurant,” Syd clarifies.

Richie is shocked at Carmy “retiring,” saying he’s “f---ing 12,” and accusing him of being on drugs. This whole season, Richie has been dealing with his feelings about belonging: his acceptance of another father figure in his young daughter’s life, mistakes he’s made at work and his efforts to grow.

They fight and Carmy blurts out that he went to his brother Mikey’s (Jon Bernthal) funeral — everyone thought he had skipped it, but the audience found out that he did when Uncle Lee (Bob Odenkirk) said he saw him earlier in the season.

Carmy and Richie have a heart to heart: Richie thought Carmy wasn’t at the funeral out of anger and resentment at him for not figuring Mikey out. Carmy says that he was actually jealous of Richie and Mikey’s relationship.
“You were like, inside my family,” Carmy says.

Richie also admits he resented Carmy for his abilities, even disclosing that he purchased a fine dining cookbook, “The French Laundry” written by Season 3 cameo’s Thomas Keller. Carmy is impressed, even though Richie calls the book “demented,” and after a beat, the main reason of this shocking departure is succinctly explained.
“I don’t know what I’m like, Richie,” Carmy says. “Like, outside of the kitchen.”
Richie becomes part owner of The Bear and Sugar gets read in
Sydney finally agrees to Carmy’s terms, but has one addition: that Richie also becomes part owner of The Bear.
“Updated partnership terms,” Sydney says. “One side Jimmy, and the other side me, Nat and Richie.”
Richie doesn’t believe it at first, thinking it was just a kind gesture, but Syd is serious, saying it’s what she needs and Carmy accepts the update to the updated terms.
“F--- yes, Chef Sydney, it is a f---ing honor,” he says. “In my official capacity as partner, I do have one question though, how the f--- do we keep this place open?”

Sugar then enters, and Richie tells her that Carmy went to Mikey’s funeral. Rather than yell like everyone else, she wordlessly hugs her brother, bursting into tears. Cut to the empty restaurant, where the clock ticks away to zero.
It’s been an emotional rollercoaster with these four, who all delivered performances in this episode we'll likely see clipped come next Emmy awards season.

FX has renewed "The Bear" for a fifth season, so Syd, Carmy, Richie and Sugar will leave that alleyway soon enough toward an uncertain future. Just like our sweet, swearing and sweaty faves, though, we’re just going to have to live in tension until those episodes drop.

title: Why Is Eva LaRue Leaving 'General Hospital?' Find Out Her Last Day
summary: Eva LaRue is leaving "General Hospital" less than a year and a half after joining the cast of the popular soap opera
story: Eva LaRue is leaving "General Hospital" less than a year and a half after joining the cast of the popular soap opera.
The daytime veteran first appeared on the ABC series in February 2024 when she took on the role of Natalia Ramirez, a villain who instantly polarized viewers.
During a new interview with Soap Opera Digest, LaRue announced her departure from the show.
“I had a blast at ‘General Hospital.’ I loved being there and I had a lot of really great scenes and I loved everybody that I got to work with," she said.
“General Hospital” executive producer Frank Valentini also confirmed LaRue’s departure in a statement to Soap Opera Digest.

“Eva’s been a dear friend for years and I am so pleased we found an opportunity to work together,” he said. “What originally was meant as a guest star arc turned into a longer and more satisfying arc, in thanks to Eva’s terrific work and chemistry with our cast. I was thrilled Eva was available to us in this extended role. I wish her all the best in her upcoming projects.”
LaRue, who is known for previously starring as Maria Santos Grey in "All My Children," said "General Hospital" "felt like home" since there are several former "All My Children" stars on the cast.
The actor's character, Natalia Ramirez, wasn't a fan favorite. Per Soap Opera Digest, she was known as a “disapproving and homophobic mother.”
Still, LaRue said most viewers were respectful while interacting with her.

“They love, love, love their show and they may not like what your character’s doing, but the majority of the fans that would come on my page were really kind and they would just say, ‘We don’t like your character, we don’t like that she’s this horrible mom, but we like the story and we like the turmoil and the chaos and we like watching it all go down,’" she said.

During the June 30 episode of "General Hospital," LaRue's character ended up in a precarious situation when she consumed a combination of pills and alcohol after learning that Sonny Corinthos (Maurice Benard) was going to send her away to Belize.
LaRue's final episode of the show will air this week.
While looking back on her last few months of filming, the actor said she started to suspect that her character wasn't going to last much longer back in January.

“They tried to rehabilitate my character and then all of a sudden, I have these scenes in January where, because Natalia had lied about her ex-husband and broken his trust, Sonny was like, ‘We can’t be friends anymore.’ And I thought, ‘Uh-oh, there we go,’ because that (relationship with Sonny) was kind of my character’s only lifeline.”
Playing a villain was "hard" for LaRue, who explained that soap opera viewers are hard core fans of their shows.
"The GH fans couldn’t stand (Natalia)! So that was tough, because especially if you are accustomed to being rooted for, to be rooted against is not as comfortable,” she said.
Still, LaRue said she had a "blast" working with her co-star, Benard and called him a "rock star."
"I was so glad they put me with Maurice. That was really fun," she said.

title: Which 'Ultimatum: Queer Love' Season 2 Couples Are Still Together Now?
summary: Which Ultimatum: Queer Love couples are together and which broke up? Find out what happens at the reunion.
story: The second season of “The Ultimatum: Queer Love” has come to a conclusion, with six couples deciding whether or not to move forward with their relationships.
As of the July 2 finale, which of the Season 2 couples got engaged? Which split up? How many are still together as of the reunion, set a year following Ultimatum Day?
Read on to learn more the current relationship status of all the contestants from“The Ultimatum: Queer Love” Season 2.
AJ Blount and Britney Thompson

What happened on the show? Britney gave AJ an ultimatum. She believed that AJ was not interested in marriage because she felt that AJ was not getting as much attention as her business. Through her trial marriage to Marita, Britney learned work-life balance. In the reunion, AJ also shared that Marita told her that Britney would always choose her before her career. By Ultimatum Day, the two were the first to get engaged.

Relationship status: AJ and Britney are still together and madly in love. AJ also stepped up her engagement game too, getting Britney a shinier ring than the one she proposed with Ultimatum Day. They don’t have a set wedding date yet. Since then, they also spend time with Dayna and Magan, and Marita.
Haley Drexler and Pilar Dizon

What happened on the show? Haley gave Pilar the ultimatum after they had been together for more than a decade. When Haley and Magan were paired for their trial marriages, one of Pilar’s greatest fears came true: they had a very close and personal bond and declared their love for one another. Haley and Pilar reconvened during the changeover, and Pilar told Haley to follow her heart. Haley ultimately embraced Pilar, saying their time during the changeover felt like a real marriage. Pilar popped the question and the two became engaged.

Relationship status: Haley and Pilar are still engaged. “She was dying to get a ring on her finger also. So I told her within the next year I would make sure that I made it a priority to get down on one knee,” Haley shared in the reunion.  “And I did it less than a month later.
While wedding dates aren’t set, they intend to elope. “I better be on it,” AJ said.
Kyle Neal and Bridget Matloff

What happened on the show? The ultimatum came from Kyle, who was ready to settle down. Bridget, meanwhile, said she “never really understood the point of marriage.” During her trial marriage with Pilar, Kyle worked through her communication issues. Meanwhile, Bridget learned that marriage is about choosing someone that you’re willing to change with. On Ultimatum Day, Bridget popped the question, and Kyle accepted.

Relationship status: The two are still happily engaged. During the reunion, Kyle’s mother recorded a video message in which she made a reference to a "Wicked" song to say how Kyle has been “changed for good.”
Mel Vitale and Marie Robertson

What happened on the show? Marie issued Mel an ultimatum as after four years together. The two shared a food truck business together and Marie was ready to settle down. Mel was put through a trial marriage with Dayna. The two became very close and got matching tattoos by the end of their experience. But this put Mel’s relationship with Marie at a crossroads. By Ultimatum Day, Mel proposed and Marie accepted.

Relationship status: As of the reunion, Marie and Mel are not together. “‘With Marie’ is nonexistent. Period,” Mel said when host JoAnna Garcia Swisher asked about their relationship. Marie broke up with Mel a couple of months after the Ultimatum experience. Their food truck business also became Mel’s.
Dayna Mathews and Magan Mourad

What happened on the show? Dayna gave Magan the ultimatum as she was ready to tie the knot. However, Magan was anxious about having to come out to her family, a dealbreaker for Dayna. In Magan’s trial marriage with Haley, the two shared a close bond and even hooked up several times. The same also goes for Dayna and Mel. During the changeover, they had a number of arguments based on their emotionally turbulent trial marriages. The two soon made up and got engaged.

Relationship status: Dayna and Magan are still engaged. Dayna experienced feelings of guilt as she reflected on her behavior and apologized to Marie. A number of adorable engagement photos and videos, including one of the couple hanging out with AJ and Britney on her birthday, were shared. Similar to every other engaged couple, they haven’t decided when to tie the knot.

Magan has finally included Dayna in her family life. “She actually came around for Thanksgiving last year,” Magan shared tearfully. “I never really brought anyone home for Thanksgiving before.” They’re now planning for both Dayna and Magan’s parents to meet soon.
Marita Prodger and Ashley Johnson

What happened on the show: Ashley issued the ultimatum to Marita. In her trial marriage with Britney, Marita made the most of their time together, as they shared a deep connection. During her trial marriage, it seemed that what Marita needed was romance. Marita said Britney showed her the affection and romance that Ashley never could.

Relationship status: On Ultimatum Day, Ashley broke it off with Marita. As of the reunion, they are still broken up. During the reunion, Ashley revealed that they traveled to Key West after the breakup. But Marita shared that Ashley tried to get her to the Keys because “none of the show mattered. All of that was for show.”

The two fought at the reunion and things got heated. Marita told Ashley she hated her and Ashley got up and walked away, sobbing. Mel went off-screen to help Ashley come down. Britney also gave Marita a hug in support. When she came back, Marita apologized, saying it would take time to reconcile.

title: The Best Books to Read This July, According to Author Brad Thor
summary: If you need a new book for the summer or your book club, you're in luck — author Brad Thor stopped by the 3rd Hour of TODAY to share his book recommendations for July 2025
story: If you need a new book for the summer or your book club, you're in luck — author Brad Thor stopped by the 3rd Hour of TODAY to share his book recommendations for July 2025.
His list includes two romance novels — one set in Hollywood and one about to be turned into a Netflix movie — and a book that's a literary hit.
Thor's latest is called "Edge of Honor" and follows Scot Harvath, America’s top spy. In this book, he's adjusting to a new administration but the same level of danger.
Edge of Honor: A Thriller by Brad Thor
Best thriller
Fade In: A Thriller by Kyle Mills
Best romance
Totally and Completely Fine: A Novel by Elissa Sussman

As a widowed mother of a rebellious teen, Lauren Parker assumed she had her one chance at true love. That all changes when she meets the dashing actor Ben Walsh. Instant chemistry. Parker soon finds herself questioning how to honor the past while still living in the present.

Alternating between Parker’s relationship with her late husband and her current one with Ben, Totally and Completely Fine showcases the balance between who you were and who you want to become. If you’re looking for a book to sweep you off your feet, Thor says this one will have you captivated by page one.
Best book to screen
My Oxford Year: A Novel by Julia Whelan

Soon to become a Netflix film starring Sofia Carson and Corey Mylchreest, "My Oxford Year" follows American Ella Durran as she studies in England on a Rhodes scholarship. Everything on her life’s checklist has been going to plan. That is, until she falls in love with her Oxford teacher, Jamie Davenport. When he confides in her a life-alternating secret, Durran must decide between flying back home to follow her political aspirations or standing by the man she loves as he awaits trial.
Best debut novel
Great Black Hope: A Novel by Rob Franklin
After an arrest for cocaine possession in the Hamptons, Smith, a queer Black Stanford graduate, finds himself torn between two worlds: his class, which protects him, and his race, which does not.

Following the death of his roommate, Smith searches for answers in New York nightlife, anonymous recovery rooms, and courtroom dramas only to discover how little he really knew about his best friend. “Equal parts Truman Capote, James Baldwin, and Elmore Leonard — Rob Franklin is an astounding literary talent,” Thor says.
Best read for kids
Some of Us: A Story of Citizenship and the United States

What does it mean to be a citizen? In this book, Huy Voun Lee explores every path to becoming an American, no matter age or background. Written in lyrical prose and illustrated with dazzling mixed-media artwork, "Some of Us" honors us all by celebrating where we came from and where we call home. Thor says this “absolute gem” is one that needs to be on every household’s and classroom’s bookshelf.

title: Ann-Margret, 84, Makes Rare TV Appearance and Shares 2 Secrets for Her Dance Moves
summary: "Bye Bye Birdie" star Ann-Margret appeared on TV for a Los Angeles fundraiser, discussing the secret to her classic dance moves.
story: More than six decades after she first wowed moviegoers, Ann-Margret still has all the right moves.
The two-time Academy Award nominee, 84, made a rare public appearance June 28 at Project Angel Food’s Lead With Love fundraiser in Los Angeles.
Video of her with “Will & Grace” star Eric McCormack during the telethon on Los Angeles’ KTLA appeared on Ann-Margret’s Instagram page, as well as the pages for the station and Project Angel Food.
The “Viva Las Vegas” and “Bye Bye Birdie” star got a rousing round of applause as she walked onto the set toward McCormack.
“I was telling you before I have a lot of male friends that are very, very jealous of me tonight because I get to stand with you,” McCormack said, alluding to her sex symbol status.
He then mentioned how Ann-Margret, who was born in Sweden, rose to fame and won over fans with her dancing.

“Obviously, your ‘60s dance moves captivated the world,” McCormack said. “They called you the female Elvis. You changed how a generation hit the dance floor, and now you’re a TikTok sensation. So, where do those incredible moves come from, Sweden? Does everyone in Sweden dance like that?”
“My heart and my seat,” she replied with a laugh, as she gently touched her posterior.
Fans certainly loved seeing Ann-Margret.
“❤️God bless Ann Margret… a true legend ❤️,” one person commented.
“BEAUTIFUL! SHE STILL CAPTIVATES THE WORLD! LOVE YOU ANN-MARGRET! XX,” someone else raved.
“She looks wonderful!!😊❤️,” another fan wrote.
“Ann-Margret, A legend whose talent and beauty continue to shine brightly ✨,” someone else gushed.
Ann-Margret is an icon whose life is in the works to become a movie, with Lindsay Lohan attached to play her.
“We’re working on the story,” Lohan told Andy Cohen on “Watch What Happens Live” in November 2024. “It’s exciting.”
“It has to be the way that she wants it to be, so I really want it to be special in that way,” she added.

title: BTS Announce New Album and 2026 Tour in First Reunion Since Completing Military Service
summary: The seven members of the group reunited during a Weverse livestream on July 1 to announce their long-awaited return to the stage and a new album.
story: It's a great day to be a BTS fan.

The seven members of the group reunited during a Weverse livestream on July 1 to announce their long-awaited return to the stage and a new album. This marked the group's first joint livestream since completing their mandatory military service.
RM, Jin, Suga, J-Hope, Jimin, V and Jung Kook chatted with their fans, known as Army, and revealed that later this month they will head to the U.S. to work on their next album.

“We’ll be releasing a new BTS album in the spring of next year. Starting in July, all seven of us will begin working closely together on new music,” the group said in a statement. “Since it will be a group album, it will reflect each member’s thoughts and ideas. We’re approaching the album with the same mindset we had when we first started.”
The album is expected to be released in spring 2026.
Additionally, the group also announced a massive world tour that will accompany their spring album.
“We’re also planning a world tour alongside the new album. We’ll be visiting fans all around the world, so we hope you’re as excited as we are,” the statement added.

This will be BTS’ first world tour since their “BTS Permission to Dance on Stage” performances concluded in 2022. That same year, the K-pop group went on hiatus, as the eldest member, Jin, started his military enlistment process.
The last time the Grammy-nominated group were all together on a livestream was in 2024 when Jin was discharged from the military.
In 2023, J-Hope and Suga were the next members to enlist in the military, with Jung Kook, V, Jimin and RM as the final four to begin their military service.
Last month, RM, V, Jung Kook and Jimin were all discharged the same week, while Suga became the last member to complete his service on June 21.

title: Everyone Who Dies in Season 3 of 'Squid Games'
summary: How does everyone die in Squid Game SEason 3? Read on for a full list.
story: The highly anticipated third and final season of "Squid Game" has premiered and, as expected, the season's death count is much higher than the list of survivors.

The South Korean series is about a competition that pits 456 strangers against each other for a prize of 4.56 billion won, or just over $3 million. The first season of “Squid Game” introduced an array of sympathetic characters, only to kill them all off during the competition, except winer Gi-hun, player 456 (Lee Jung-jae).
It happens again when Gi-hun enters a new round of Squid Game in Season 2. The third season concludes the game, resulting in the deaths of more favorite characters.
Below, find a recap of how "Squid Game" Season 3's main characters met their gruesome fates.
Warning: Spoilers for all of “Squid Game” ahead!
Hyun-ju (Player 120)

Hyun-ju (Park Sung-hoon) is killed by Myung-gi (Im Si-wan) in the keys and knives game. During the game of hide and seek, she tries to escape the maze while players like Myung-gi scour the course with a knife with the objective to kill.

While trying to fight off another player, Hyun-ju stumbles upon the exit. Instead of leaving, she runs back to Jun-hee (Jo Yu-ri), who is in labor, and Geum-ja (Geum-ja), who is helping her, to alert them of the exit. Hyun-ju needs their keys to open the door.
Before she can find them, Myung-gi — who happens to be the father of Jun-hee’s baby — stabs Hyun-ju in the back.
Seon-nyeo (Player 044)
Min-su (Lee David) kills Seon-nyeo (Chae Gook-hee) in the keys and knives game. Her death is somewhat accidental — he mistakes her for Nam-gyu (Roh Jae-won), who had poked fun at him in the past.
Dae-ho (Player 388)
Dae-ho (Kang Ha-neul) also dies during the keys and knives game. Gi-hun strangles him, believing Dae-ho was responsible for the failure of the rebellion that took place in the end of Season 2.

During the rebellion, Dae-ho was ordered to return to the players’ sleeping quarters to retrieve ammunition. During this moment, he suffered from a panic attack, leaving him frozen in fear and unable to run back to Gi-hun. The rebellion then fails.
Gi-hun, who loses his best friend in the rebellion, had his eyes on Dae-ho since.
Yong-sik (Player 007)
Yong-sik (Yang Dong-geun) is killed by the pink guards in the keys and knives game.
In the lead-up to his death, Yong-sik tries to kill Jun-hee to ensure he makes it to the next round. He had been unable to kill anyone and Jun-hee, having just given birth, is an easy target.
Yong-sik's mother, Geum-ja, offers herself up instead. When he lunges for Jun-hee, Geum-ja stops him by stabbing him with her hair pin.
Though Geum-ja’s stab is not fatal, it deters Yong-sik from killing Jun-hee. The pink guards shoot him as his mother screams.
Geum-ja (Player 149)
Geum-ja (Kang Ae-shim) takes her own life after the keys and knives game.
Shortly after the game, Geum-ja helps Jun-hee and her baby while confiding in Gi-hun about the guilt she feels for the circumstances of her son’s death.
The next morning, she is found hanging from her bed.
Nam-gyu (Player 124)
Nam-gyu (Roh Jae-won) dies during the jump rope game.

Throughout the game, Nam-gyu is seen taking drugs from a cross necklace that once belonged to his friend, Thanos. During the game, Min-su throws Nam-gyu's necklace onto the jump rope bridge that players have to pass to survive.

Without hesitation, Nam-gyu aims for the necklace, thinking that his drugs are still there. When he opens the necklace, he realizes it's empty. The jump rope catches his legs and throws him off the bridge to his death.
Jun-hee (Player 222)
Jun-hee (Jo Yu-ri) dies during the jump rope game due to her swollen, broken ankle from the keys and knives game.

Though she is seen practicing jumping before her turn, she realizes quickly that her chances of surviving are slim. As Gi-hun safely gets her baby across the bridge, Jun-hee bids farewell and falls to her death, rather than trying to cross the bridge.
After her death, the creators of the game determine that her baby will carry on her number as Player 222.
Captain Park
Captain Park (Oh Dal-su) is killed by Detective Hwang Jun-ho (Detective Hwang Jun-ho) on his boat.

While sifting through Captain Park’s office, one of Jun-ho’s mercenaries, Woo-seok, finds a pink guard suit and mask, proving that Captain Park only been posing as a fisherman and in reality, had a part in the game.
Captain Park tries to kill Jun-ho and his allies on the boat. Jun-ho fatally shoots him from behind instead.
Min-su (Player 125)

Min-su (Lee David) is killed by Myung-gi during the final game, Sky Squid Game. In it, players play the Korean classic game from Season 1 — only this time, they're high above ground and can fall to their deaths.

During a hallucination, he encounters Se-mi, a player who had defended him from Thanos and Nam-gyu’s group. He felt immense guilt for after being too scared to save her from her death. In this hallucination, Se-mi accepts his apology and reaches out for his hand, telling him to follow her.
Audiences then see Min-su charge at Myung-gi with a pole, pushing him off the elevated platform.
While participating in Sky Squid Game, all five players are pushed off of the elevated surface, falling to their deaths.
Myung-gi (Player 333)
Myung-gi (Yim Si-wan) is one of the game's final three players, along with his infant child and Gi-hun.

The final two argue between who to sacrifice, as Myung-gi threatens to kill his baby. Eventually, Myung-gi and Gi-hun end up hanging from the surface’s edge. Myung-gi is saved by holding onto a jacket Gi-hun is holding. Gi-hun lets go of the jacket, resulting in Myung-gi’s death.
Gi-hun (Player 456)
Gi-hun (Lee Jung-jae) takes his own life in Sky Squid Game by falling to his death.
Because of the game’s complicated rules, Myung-gi’s death does not “count,” and Gi-hun must decide between taking his own life or sacrificing Jun-hee’s baby.
Before making his final decision, he tells the overlooking Front Man and the VIPs that humans are not “horses” — people cannot bet on humans as pawns.
In a powerful message, Gi-hun falls off the surface, making Jun-hee’s baby the winner of this round of Squid Game.

title: EXCLUSIVE: ‘Love Island USA’ Host Ariana Madix on Nic and Cierra, Taylor and Olandria — and the 1 Dumping That Shocked Her
summary: Ariana Madix is well into her second season as host of “Love Island USA” and has been able to witness some of this summer’s most dramatic and wildly viral moments involving the islanders out in Fiji.
story: Ariana Madix is well into her second season as host of “Love Island USA” and has been able to witness some of this summer’s most dramatic and wildly viral moments involving the islanders out in Fiji.

In an interview with TODAY.com just before Episode 25 dropped, Madix gave a peek behind the curtain of what goes on in the villa — plus, her takes on Nic and Cierra, Olandria and Taylor, and the dumping from the island that shocked her the most.
More on ‘Love Island USA’

For ‘Love Island USA’ Season 7, Ariana Madix Is Ready to ‘Completely Throw Out the Playbook’Did Hannah From ‘Love Island USA’ Expect Pepe To Leave With Her? What She SaysSo What Happens With Nic and Olandria on ‘Love Island USA’?Who Are Huda and Jeremiah, and What Happened With Them on ‘Love Island USA’?
For ‘Love Island USA’ Season 7, Ariana Madix Is Ready to ‘Completely Throw Out the Playbook’
Did Hannah From ‘Love Island USA’ Expect Pepe To Leave With Her? What She Says
So What Happens With Nic and Olandria on ‘Love Island USA’?
Who Are Huda and Jeremiah, and What Happened With Them on ‘Love Island USA’?
This interview has been edited for clarity.
So how involved are you on the production side of things? Do you get to decide when new bombshells are coming in, when to change up the rules for Casa, like we did this year?

No, I just hear about things maybe a couple days beforehand. Or, you know, of course, if there’s something that’s planned way in advance, I’ll hear about it, and I can say, “Wow, I love that.” Or, “Hmm, I’m not sure about that,” but it doesn’t matter. I’m not in charge.
Let’s talk about Nic and Olandria. Do you think we’ll be seeing a return of them later this season? I know on “Aftersun,” you mentioned that you saw some chemistry between them.

Yeah, I think the chemistry, when you watch that kiss in Soul Ties, was palpable from watching it on the screen. When they said that they didn’t feel any sparks, I was very confused because I feel like I saw sparks. That being said, you know, I think, honestly, I just want both of them to find whatever it is that they’re looking for. And I’m so happy that whatever it took to get Olandria a little bit away from thinking about Taylor, I think is a positive.

I mean, that being said, I love Cierra and Nic together, so I don’t want to speak ill of that relationship, because I think that is a really good relationship, too. But you know, who knows? You never know what’s going to happen day to day in that villa. Things happen so fast.
What do you think about some of the other couples on the show, like Chelley and Ace, and Zak and Amaya?

I mean, I feel like Chelley and Ace, they took so long to actually couple up, which was interesting, because I felt like they had had this flirtation for so long, but you know, watching the episode with the heart-rate challenge, you see that Chelley still wants to remain open to Chris, so that’s going to be interesting. I feel like Ace might be getting a little bit of a taste of his own medicine there, because he was really putting on the pressure when Chelley was with Austin. And now Chelley’s with Ace, and Chris is putting on the pressure, so he feel knows what it feels like to be on the other side of that.

Amaya and Zach. I think they’re so cute. I love getting to see these little moments of them talk about cats or, you know, hula hooping in Casa. I just love the slice-of-life moments in the villa that we get to see because to me, that’s when you really get to see what everyone’s like around each other. So I hope we get to see more of that and more of them as well.
Let’s talk about the virality of it all. “Love Island” has been blowing up absolutely everywhere. Do you see these viral moments as they’re happening, or are you just as surprised as we are?

I mean, I watch all the episodes, of course, and then you never know what’s going to gain traction online, what’s going to be something that people really connect with. And so with the “mommy-mamacita” moment, I feel like watching the episode, I thought that was a hilarious moment, but then when it took on a life of its own online, it made it even more fun. And I feel like I’m constantly reposting people doing that audio now, because it’s just too funny.
Megan Thee Stallion came on the show! Let’s talk about that iconic and surprising collaboration, as well as whether any other influential figures might be fans of the show.

It’s funny, because I feel like every year, we find more and more influential figures that are big fans. Or, even right now, with Olivia Rodrigo and Ed Sheeran doing the “Love Island” audio — I’m pretty sure Ed Sheeran communicates via email, so he probably does not watch “Love Island USA” — but to have Olivia explaining to him what is “Love Island USA,” to me, is a moment that I wish I could be a fly on the wall for because I can only imagine how funny that is. And Megan Thee Stallion, is someone I’ve been a huge fan of for a very long time. I’ve gone to see her live performing so many times, and getting to meet her, she is an absolute delight of a person. She has the most beautiful energy, and I’m in love with her.

Viewers didn’t get to see the deliberation process when Hannah and Jeremiah left the villa, which Iain told us earlier was the most shocking thing he’d seen all season long. What might be a little bit of the process behind that deliberation? If you heard anything, would you be able to speak on that?

I wasn’t in the villa that day, so I wasn’t watching, you know, the monitors of what they were talking about. But considering that, it was a big moment, and when they’re editing that episode and putting it together, my major guesstimation is that they really wanted to keep in other conversations that they felt were really important to the storyline. So maybe more showing him or other people talking earlier in the episode about things, and then maybe after the fact, they wanted to really be able to show more of what it was like when everyone was saying goodbye and stuff like that. And if the deliberation was redundant or boring or fairly inconsequential or not really different to what they were talking about outside of the actual deliberation, there’s really no point in showing it.
I know you didn’t want to say earlier who you’re rooting for this season, but is there a couple that maybe you’re not as excited to see on your screen?

I guess ... they’re not a couple as of this point that I know of right now, but I am never excited to see Taylor be wishy-washy about who he wants to be in a couple with, and I’m definitely never excited to see Olandria second-guess her worth. Those are two things I’m never excited to see. So I am kind of hoping that she finds the right person for her and not someone who’s wishy-washy about whether or not they want to be with her.
What is the most shocking thing that you’ve seen this season?
Oh, I think Charlie’s dumping was very shocking. I really did not expect that at all.
Do you ever expect the dumps going in? What’s the preparation process behind that?

Sometimes you never really know. I feel like going in, it’s a little bit of you can guess, or you can say, like, OK, I feel like I’ve seen these two people become a little bit closer, but whether or not they’re actually going to pick this person or that person — there’s really no way to know. And it’s really down to the moment, and the islanders make their decisions. And sometimes I’m like, OK, that makes sense, I get it. And other times I’m just completely shocked — like Charlie, for example.
What’s next for you?

Well, I will be going back to Los Angeles, and I have a long list of things that I need to get done, and I will be back in the sandwich shop in West Hollywood. Please come see us — Something About Her — and have a sandwich. I’ll be there for some time.

title: Jennifer Aniston to Star in Adaptation of 'I'm Glad My Mom Died'
summary: Jennifer Aniston will executive produce and star in a new Apple TV+ series inspired by Jennette McCurdy's 2022 memoir, "I’m Glad My Mom Died."
story: Jennifer Aniston will executive produce and star in a new Apple TV+ series inspired by Jennette McCurdy's 2022 memoir, "I’m Glad My Mom Died," the streaming service announced July 1.
The 10-episode dramedy will be adapted by McCurdy, who will also executive produce and act as a showrunner alongside Ari Katcher ("Ramy,” “Jerrod Carmichael Reality Show”).
The former “iCarly” star's memoir details her struggles as a child actor in the mid-2000s while living with her abusive mother.

Though McCurdy portrayed the spirited and wisecracking Sam Puckett on “iCarly," her life behind the scenes was dominated by debilitating anxiety and a strained relationship with her mother, who forced her into show business, according to her memoir.

The TV adaptation of the book "will center on the codependent relationship between an 18-year-old actress in a hit kid’s show, and her narcissistic mother who relishes in her identity as 'a starlet’s mother,'" set to be played by Aniston, the streaming service said.
Aniston currently collaborates with Apple TV+ on “The Morning Show.” The Emmy-winning drama will return for a fourth season on Sept. 17.
In October 2022, McCurdy told TODAY.com she wrote "I’m Glad My Mom Died" because she believed her story was "worth sharing." She also wanted to help readers heal from their own difficult childhoods.
“I felt compelled to write it,” said McCurdy, now 33. “I think that’s often the case with anybody who is in the arts, that once you feel compelled to do something, you just have to.”
Writing down her story was therapeutic for McCurdy, she told TODAY.com, and it allowed her to finally miss her mother without “complicated grief of anger.”

“She didn’t deserve for me to miss her because she was so abusive,” McCurdy said. “But now, I’m able to just have moments where I miss her, and I think it’s because of the massive healing that happened through therapy and ultimately through the validation of this book and other people sharing their stories with me.”

title: Mariska Hargitay Says Son August 'Looks Exactly' Like Her Mom, Jayne Mansfield. See the Resemblance
summary: Mariska Hargitay said in an interview on “The Run-Through with Vogue” podcast that her older son with Peter Hermann, August, "looks so much" like her late mom.
story: Mariska Hargitay isn’t only sharing the story of her mother, Jayne Mansfield, with the world, but with her children.

The filmmaker opened up in a recent interview about her journey of wanting to better understand her mother, who died when Hargitay was 3. One of her methods? Celebrating Mansfield with her own kids, August, Amaya and Andrew, whom she shares with husband Peter Hermann.

The family threw a birthday party for Mansfield, who died in 1967 in a car accident at age 34, during the COVID-19 pandemic. The footage from the party is featured in Hargitay’s documentary about Mansfield, “My Mom Jayne,” which she directed and produced and is streaming now on Max.

Hargitay said on the July 1 episode of “The Run-Through with Vogue” podcast that she called up HBO during the pandemic to tell them she was ready to make the film, which was around the same time she threw the party.
“They thought it was the coolest thing, and it was so fun,” Hargitay said of her kids’ thoughts of the celebration. “They loved it. They all wrote her cards. … We decorated the table.”
The party décor, which included plenty of pink hearts, can be seen in the film through photos and video.
“Not a lot of people throw birthday parties for their dead mothers,” Hargitay says in the documentary, as footage plays of August carrying a heart-shaped cake to the table.

“But there was this sort of magic to it,” she adds. “It was around that time that I began to feel like I actually wanted to get to know her. Not as the sex symbol Jayne Mansfield, but just as Jayne. My mom, Jayne.”
Hargitay described the party on the podcast as “a really beautiful ceremony” that was “so joyful.”
“Even for them, it started to become a fun, beautiful thing,” she said of her kids.

The co-hosts asked Hargitay if her kids had previously inquired about Mansfield. Hargitay explained her younger children, Amaya and Andrew, whom she and Hermann adopted in 2011, were too young at the time of the party. She noted that she would talk to her older son, August, who was born to her and her husband in 2006, about it and also show him things about her.
“He also looks so much like her,” Hargitay said. “August looks exactly like her.”
More recently, August paid tribute to his late grandmother by wearing her signature stitched into the lapel of his suit at the Tribeca Festival premiere for the film.
Hargitay told TODAY.com the story behind the homage.

“My son was so sweet because I wanted to put a heart or maybe a — you know, we talked about possibly putting a ‘J’ on his lapel, and then all of a sudden I went (gasps), ‘Her signature was so beautiful,’ and it’s part of the film.”
Pink, glittering footage at the beginning of the documentary shows Mansfield writing her signature, “Jayne,” with a pink heart, both of which were featured on August’s suit.
Hargitay said she gave her tailor her mother’s signature, and he put it on the lapel.
She was so “blown away” by the result that she “just started weeping.”
“My son was so proud to wear it,” she said. “It was really extraordinary.”
On June 29, the anniversary of Mansfield’s death, Hargitay posted old photos of herself next to a young August beside her mother’s grave.

The documentary ends on a high note when Hermann surprises Hargitay by gifting her Mansfield’s piano, which he tracked down through the family of Engelbert Humperdinck, a previous owner of Mansfield’s “Pink Palace” home.
On the podcast, Hargitay said her children are taking piano lessons.
“To see them play on this piano …” she said.
As for herself, Hargitay told The New York Times last month: “That’s my next thing — I’m going to learn to play soon.”
“My Mom Jayne” is streaming now on Max.

title: Scarlett Johansson Faced Her 'Greatest Phobia' While Shooting 'Jurassic World Rebirth'
summary: Scarlett Johansson reveals her biggest phobia and whether or not she faced it while filming "Jurassic World Rebirth" in the jungle.
story: Scarlett Johansson can now say she’s an official star of the “Jurassic Park” franchise, an accomplishment that’s been 30 years in the making.
“It was a childhood dream of mine to be in this movie,” the actor told Craig Melvin during a recent segment on TODAY. “I’ve been trying to get in the 'Jurassic' universe for three decades.”

In the latest installment of the series, “Jurassic World Rebirth,” Johansson plays Zora Bennett, a mercenary leading a team of operatives on a secret mission to track down dinosaur DNA. The hitch? It’s on a forbidden island in the middle of the ocean and the inhabitants are, well, positively prehistoric.

“I saw the movie ‘Jurassic Park’ when I was 10 years old in the theater and it was so impactful,” Johansson said. “Like the entire audience, I was completely transfixed, mesmerized, carried away, terrified, all of that stuff, and it’s part of the formative part of my childhood.”
How did she finally land the gig?
“It turns out that if you harass Frank Marshall enough, you could get a job,” she joked, referring to one of the film's producers.

Clocking in at two hours and 14 minutes, “Jurassic World Rebirth” is an action-packed, dino-filled romp that also stars Jonathan Bailey, Rupert Friend, Mahershala Ali, Manuel Garcia-Rulfo, Ed Skrein, David Iacono and Luna Blaise as a mismatched crew of castaways fighting for survival on the tropical island.
To ensure the movie’s authenticity, Johansson says, the cast and crew filmed at various exotic locations around the world, including Malta and Thailand.
“The environment was authentic and so it felt that we were in the middle of the jungle because we were in the middle of the jungle,” she tells TODAY.com in an interview.
According to the “Avengers” actor, working in the jungle didn’t come without its fair share of perils, including uninvited guests on the set.

“You’d be making coffee at the coffee table and then two minutes later (someone would say), ‘You know what they just found at the coffee table? They just got a scorpion.’ And you’re like, ‘What!?’ Like, I was just making myself a coffee right there,” says Johansson. “We had a venomous pit crew. Isn’t that crazy?”
Filming “Jurassic World Rebirth” also required Johansson to scale a steep rock wall. Granted, it was built on a set, but according to Johansson, it was still "pretty high up."
Even so, Johansson, 40, says she wasn't daunted given the rigging crew had her back (literally) and that she’d been trained on a rock-climbing wall ahead of shooting the scenes.
“The heights is not, like, my greatest phobia,” she tells TODAY.com. “My greatest phobia is cockroaches, and there were plenty of those, too – but not on the abseiling wall.”
Instead, Johansson likely encountered them while shooting in Thailand's rainforests.
“Thailand had some pretty serious creature critters,” she says.
It begs the question: Were there days during the making of “Jurassic World Rebirth” when she wished she was on a traditional film set instead of the remote reaches of the world?
“Yes, all of the days. Every one of them,” she joked while talking with Craig on TODAY.
“I’m from New York. I’ve got to say I’m a city girl. ... It is amazing to shoot in the majestic settings that we were in,” she explained. But it didn't come without the obvious drawbacks.
“We did shoot during the monsoon season," Johansson added. "I would say not as ideal as in the not-monsoon season. I watched Mahershala Ali melt like a human candle.”

title: See the Fallout From Nan’s Big Secret in Sneak Peek of ‘The Buccaneers’ Episode 3
summary: Nan has had another major secret revealed, and this time Theo is demanding answers. See TODAY.com's exclusive clip from Episode 3.
story: Nan has had another major secret revealed, and this time Theo is demanding answers.

So far during the second season of Apple TV+’s “The Buccaneers,” Nan, played by Kristine Frøseth, has been dealing with the fallout from everything she's done to protect her sister, who ran away to Italy to escape her abusive husband.

During the Season 1 finale, Nan chose to wed Theo, the Duke of Tintagel (Guy Remmers), despite her stronger feelings for Guy (Matthew Broome) because she knew the marriage would make her a duchess, thus giving her power. But the night before her wedding, Nan had one last romantic night with Guy where they both expressed their love for each other.

Nan kept the clandestine encounter from Theo, but he learned the truth in Episode 2 from Lord Seadown (Barney Fishwick), setting up an intense confrontation in the next episode, which drops on Apple TV+ July 2.
In an exclusive clip from Episode 3, Theo angrily questions Nan about the night she shared with Guy.
The scene picks up with Theo spiraling as he wonders what occurred between his wife and his best friend.
“What happened during that night apart from talking? Was he in your bed?” he asks a speechless Nan.
After Theo screams at her, Nan finally gives him an answer.
See the full clip, below.

While the newlyweds are having a rocky start to their marriage, the rest of “The Buccaneers” group have also been facing challenges in Season 2. Mabel and Honoria are still keeping their relationship a secret from their families, Jinny is raising her baby away from her family and Conchita and Richard’s finances are limited. Meanwhile, Lizzy is navigating a possible romance with Hector Robinson.
The synopsis for Episode 3 teases that more drama and romance is on the way for the group of friends.
“A betrayal, a reunion, and an unexpected spark — Lizzy’s enchanted birthday party will be one to remember,” the description reads.

title: ‘Jeopardy!’ Revisits 2001 Contestant Who Had Family Tie to Clue: ‘Isn't It Amazing?’
summary: “Jeopardy!” posted a clip of a contestant in 2001 who had a family connection to a clue, a week after a similar incident happened on the show.
story: “Jeopardy!” had a quirky moment last week when a contestant revealed she had a family connection to the clue during Final Jeopardy! As it turns out, that wasn’t the first time something like that has happened.
On June 27, the show’s Instagram account answered a fan question asking if that has ever taken place before.
“At least once! Back in 2001, Bill O’Donnell got a clue about his great-grandfather, George Ferris,” the show captioned a clip of the moment.
The occurrence happened during the $200 clue in the category “Stupid Answers.”
“Last name of the engineer who built the first Ferris wheel,” the clue read.
“Who’s my grandfather, George Ferris?” O’Donnell rang in.
“Are you serious,” host Alex Trebek replied.
“Yeah,” O’Donnell responded with a laugh.
“How about that?” Trebek said.
“My great-grandfather, actually,” O’Donnell said, correcting himself.
“It’s not just a stupid answer. It’s a stupid answer within the family. And that’s great. Go again,” Trebek said.
Trebek later chatted with O’Donnell about the coincidence.

“Now, isn’t it amazing?” he said. “We were talking, our producer and I, during the commercial break about what the odds must be that we would write a clue about the Ferris wheel. You would ring in on that clue. It would come up in your game, and he would turn out to be your great-grandfather.”
During the June 23 “Jeopardy!” episode, the Final Jeopardy! question read, “In 1896, the Vassar-educated wife of this man wrote, ‘Thousands of dollars may be paid for a copy of Shakespeare.’”
Emily Croke answered “Folger,” making her the lone contestant to get it right, before she revealed her connection to the name.
“That was my great-great-great-aunt Emily,” she said while smiling in a clip shared by the “Jeopardy!” Instagram account.
“The one we mentioned in the clue is the person you, Emily Croke, are named after?” host Ken Jennings asked.
“Yes,” Croke replied.
That prompted fan reaction on Instagram, including one person who assumed a family connection to a clue had never happened.
“I don’t think that in the entire history of Jeopardy, that any clue before was accidentally written about a contestant’s family!!” one person wrote.

“The odds are astounding considering the longevity of the show and the probability of being on the show when the question is asked and the millions of applicants who apply to play!!!!” one person wrote. “We have a better chance of winning the lotteries!!!!👏👏🔥🔥❤️❤️😂.”

title: 'DWTS' Adds 2 ‘Secret Lives of Mormon Wives’ Stars to Its Season 34 Cast
summary: "Secret Lives of Mormon Wives" stars Whitney Leavitt and Jen Affleck are set to join Season 34 of "Dancing with the Stars" alongside Robert Irwin and Alix Earle.
story: Whitney Leavitt and Jen Affleck are hitting the dance floor.

The two "Secret Lives of Mormon Wives" stars will be competing in Season 34 of "Dancing With the Stars." The news was first revealed during the reality show's reunion special that debuted on Hulu on July 1, when host Nick Viall told the girls which one of them will be on the Emmy-winning series.
"Tonight we are going to be announcing who is going to be on the next season of "Dancing With the Stars!'" he said as everyone gasped.
Viall noted that “most” of the cast auditioned for the role and out of everyone who auditioned, only Affleck and Leavitt will be on the show.
After hearing the news, Affleck started to tear up.
"I hope you know you're going down," she jokingly told Leavitt.

The official Instagram account of "DWTS" also confirmed the news. On July 1, the show shared a clip of the reunion special when Viall told Affleck and Leavitt that they were going to be dancing their way to the Len Goodman Mirrorball Trophy.
"The Mormon, the merrier! Welcome to #DWTS, @jenniferlaffleck and @whitleavitt 👯‍♀️," the post read.
Affleck and Leavitt will be joining influencer Alix Earle and wildlife conservationist Robert Irwin on the dance floor.

On May 22, Earle shared the news in a TikTok video of herself trying to do the whisk, writing, "It's okay ... Guess I'll learn this Season on DWTS." A month earlier, Irvin revealed himself as the first cast member of Season 34 while attending Disney Entertainment Television’s Get Real Event April 22, per E! News.
Julianne Hough and Alfonso Ribeiro will be returning as hosts for the new season of "DWTS." As a former pro dancer on the series, Hough reflected on what the show meant to her in an Instagram post.

“Dancing with the Stars has been part of my life for 18 years, and it’s truly shaped who I am,” she wrote on April 7. “From dancing as a pro in the ballroom to judging on the panel and now co-hosting with my bestie @therealalfonsoribeiro this journey has been full of growth, joy, and deep deep connection.”

title: Broadway Singer Was Interrupted Onstage By Her Toddler. Her Response Made The Performance Go Viral
summary: Broadway actress Jennie Harney-Fleming was singing an encore when her daughter screamed, "I want to go home." The video of what happened next went viral.
story: Broadway actress Jennie Harney-Fleming had just starting singing the encore at her solo concert in the New York City area when she heard a little voice yell: "I want to go home!"
The heckler was none other than Harney-Fleming's 3-year-old daughter Olivia, who was up past her bedtime.
Without missing a beat, Harney-Fleming said, "Come here, baby. Come here, Olivia. Come to Mommy. It's too loud, I know."

Wearing a fitted sequin dress and heels, Harney-Fleming picked Olivia up, returned to the mic and restarted the classic song "Feeling Good." The video of Fleming singing the entire song while holding her daughter with one arm has garnered more than 2.7 million views on Instagram in 10 days ... plus the attention of celebrities.
But in the moment, Olivia only wanted attention from one person: her mom.
"When I came back and started singing the second song, my daughter was like, 'Girl, we got to wrap this up!'" Harney-Fleming tells TODAY.com.

The concert began at 8pm and it was only an hour long, but that was way past bedtime for Olivia and her 5-year-old sister Ella. "They did very well sitting through that show," Harney-Flemming shares. "But I think my little one just reached her breaking point."

The actress has grown used to changing plans on a dime. After all, before she played Angelica Schuyler in the Broadway company of "Hamilton," she became the "universal swing" for the Schuyler sisters on tour in 2017. That meant that if any one of the actresses playing Angelica, Eliza or Peggy were sick in any production across the country, she would grab her suitcase of costumes, hop on a plane and perform on stage that evening.

So when she heard Olivia complaining, Harney-Fleming says she  "didn't give it a second thought. I think if we tried to deal with it any other way, she might have had a meltdown and caused a scene. I just knew what needed to be done and told her she was safe to come stay with me while I finish up the show."
Another familiar face was on stage that evening: Olivia's father, DeWitt Fleming Jr., who was playing the drums.

The actors first met — where else? — while starring in an off-Broadway show. And in late 2024, the couple enjoyed a musical dream: performing in principal roles in Broadway's "A Wonderful World: The Louis Armstrong Musical." Ella and Olivia spent every Saturday hanging out with their mom and dad backstage at the theater.
"It was important for them to see Mommy and Daddy on stage," Harney-Fleming says. "We feel that it's very important to keep our children in the loop of what it means when we say we're going to work."
Theater is in the girls' blood: Harney-Fleming's father received the Tony Award for his role as Curtis Taylor, Jr. in the original production of "Dreamgirls."

"He went on to have a really wonderful career, but ultimately made the decision to leave the industry, both for ministry as well as for his family," says Harney-Flemming. "That really left an indelible mark on me in terms of how I move through the industry now, and how we prioritize our time and our relationships in these professional spaces."
Many notable performers expressed support for Harney-Fleming's viral video.
The original Angelica Schuyler (and fellow Broadway mom) Renée Elise Goldsberry wrote, "Thank you for the master class!"
Natasha Bedingfield commented, "I love this so much. ❤️ Incredible mom and incredible singing."
Holly Robinson Peete added, "I needed this today," and Amy Schumer reposted the video.
Questlove commented, "I did this to my dad at MSG once in 1973 … Did not end like this lol."

Harney-Fleming says she feels incredibly grateful for the support, and to answer the question everyone seemed to be asking: she's not sure how she sang a song with such incredible breath control while holding her daughter in one arm.

"Sometimes as a mom, you look back on your day and you're like, 'How the heck did I get all those things done?'" she says. "You rise to the occasion, and you don't give the workload a second thought. You just do it because it needs to be done."

title: Who Is Player 222 in 'Squid Game'? How a Baby Became the Season's Most Pivotal Character
summary: Who is Squid Game's Player 222 and what happens to them? How does a baby win the game?
story: The final episodes of Netflix’s "Squid Game" Season 3 push the dystopian series into darker moral territory, with one of its most emotional arcs centered on Player 222, a pregnant woman forced to fight for her life and that of her unborn child.
Player 222, Kim Jun-hee (played by Jo Yu-ri), is introduced as a quiet but resilient contestant.

Viewers soon learn she was lured into the game after being conned by her ex-boyfriend, Player 333, Lee Myung-gi (Im Si-wan), who tricked her into investing in a cryptocurrency scam that leaves her in debt.
Here's what to know about her fate, and her child's.
What happens to Player 222 in the games?
In a pivotal hide-and-seek challenge, Jun-hee breaks her ankle and goes into labor.

With help from Player 149, Jang Geum-ja (Kang Ae-shim), a former nurse, and Player 120, Cho Hyun-ju (Park Sung-hoon), the show’s first transgender character, she gives birth while hiding from guards and other competitors.
Injured and exhausted, Jun-hee fights to continue but ultimately realizes she cannot survive the next round.
In a heartbreaking moment, she says goodbye to her friend Seong Gi-hun (Player 456, played by Lee Jung-jae) and willingly falls to her death, entrusting her newborn to him.
In a grim twist, the game’s creators assign the baby her mother’s number, officially making the infant the new Player 222.
What happens to Player 222, the baby?
By the final game, only three players remain: Gi-hun, Myung-gi and the baby, who is Myung-gi's child.
During the “Sky Squid” challenge, Myung-gi attempts to take the child, but falls to his death after Gi-hun’s coat tears under his weight.
But there’s a catch: Myung-gi’s death occurred before the round officially began. The game cannot end until one more player dies. Gi-hun faces an impossible choice — kill himself, or kill the baby.
Honoring his promise to Jun-hee, Gi-hun chooses to leap to his death, saving the child. Hwang In-ho (Lee Byung-hun), better known as Front Man, takes the baby.
Where does the baby end up?

The show picks up six months later. Detective Hwang Jun-ho (Wi Ha-joon) receives a package: the infant, along with a debit card and a note that reads, “The winner.” The final image shows the newborn cradled in Jun-ho’s arms.
"Squid Game" creator Hwang Dong-hyuk told Netflix's press site Tudum, “Ultimately, the baby represents the future generation.”

“I believe we also have the responsibility and duty to try everything that we can in our power to leave a better world for the future generation.” he continued. “The baby coming out the winner was in line with the meaning of 'Squid Game'.”
So, is the baby real or CGI?
The question on every "Squid Game" viewer's mind: Is the baby real?
Lee Jung-Jae clarified to Variety that a robotic doll was used.
“The robot had actual facial expressions. It would wiggle like a newborn baby, and the weight was quite realistic. So that helped me a lot with my performance,” Lee said.

title: 'Cobra Kai' Star Alicia Hannah-Kim Breaks Silence on Biting Incident. What Happened?
summary: “Cobra Kai” star Alicia Hannah-Kim speaks out about biting incident with Martin Kove. What happened between them? What did he do?
story: “Cobra Kai” star Alicia Hannah-Kim is speaking out for the first time since co-star Martin Kove reportedly bit her during a fan event.

The two actors attended Summer Con in Puyallup, Washington, on June 22 and participated in a VIP meet-and-greet with fans, NBC News reported at the time. When Hannah-Kim tapped Kove to say hello, he responded by allegedly grabbing her arm and biting her, she explained in a police report obtained by NBC News.
On June 29, Hannah-Kim addressed the incident in a video shared on her Instagram account. She began by thanking everyone who reached out during the past week to check on her.
“I was really enjoying my time at Summer Con. I love meeting you guys in real life,” the Australian actor told her fans before thanking her handler for taking care of her.

“But as you can see, this was a serious incident,” she continued as the camera angle revealed what appeared to be a bruise on her upper arm. “No one wants to be attacked at work or anywhere really. And I don’t think anybody would think that this is normal or warranted or acceptable.”
She said that it was the important and correct decision for her to stand up for herself after the encounter, without mentioning Kove’s name.

Hannah-Kim added, “I also want to express that this does not represent my experience with the show at large. I think everybody can tell that it’s a really good vibe and a great cast and everybody else is delightful. So, I don’t want this to affect your love for the show. Feel free to love on it as hard as you want.”
She explained at the end of the clip that she wanted to post the message to “clear it up and move on.”
In the caption, she again expressed her gratitude for those who sent their love and support.
Hannah-Kim’s public response follows her aforementioned police report which included a handwritten statement with more details about her interaction with Kove.
Who are Martin Kove and Alicia Hannah-Kim?
Kove and Hannah-Kim are co-stars in “Cobra Kai,” which ran on Netflix from 2018 to 2025.
Kove, 78, has starred on “Cobra Kai” since 2018 and reprised his role of John Kreese from the original 1984 “The Karate Kid” film.
Hannah-Kim, 37, has appeared on “Cobra Kai” since 2022 and portrays martial artist Kim Da-Eun.
What happened between ‘Cobra Kai’ stars Martin Kove and Alicia Hannah-Kim?
NBC News obtained the handwritten statement that Hannah-Kim provided in the police report in which she accused Kove of biting her.

She wrote, “I walked past Martin Kove, tapped him on the shoulder and said hello & he turned around grabbed my arm and bit down hard almost drawing blood. I yelped and drew back and then he grabbed my arm again to kiss it.”
The actor said she “pulled away and rushed back to my table.”
Hannah-Kim explained that she then alerted a police officer in the VIP section of Summer Con and reported the incident.
According to NBC News, the police report mentioned a “very easy to see bite mark” that was beginning to turn blue and bruise.
Hannah-Kim also told her husband about the incident and the two went to address the situation with Kove, the police report said. Kove “exploded on them” and did not admit fault, the report said.
The report said that when the officer spoke to Kove he acknowledged that he had bitten Hannah-Kim’s arm.
In a bodycam video captured at the event, Hannah-Kim confronts Kove.
“That is assault!” she tells him after an officer explains that Kove cannot bite people.
When the officer asks Kove to explain himself, he replies, “I apologize. I was just playing because we’re really playful together and I bit down too far.”

Hannah-Kim turns to face Kove and interjects, “No, we do not play like that ... and right now Martin, I am really pissed. You have left a mark on my body, which in your 80-year-old brain you think is ‘play.’ Sir, were you raised in a ditch? You yelled at me. You had the audacity. How dare you, sir?”
Kove says, “I’m very sorry that I got angry because I was indulging in something improper by doing that. And I’m very, sincerely, sorry.”
